PRICE THIS VENUE Price this venue to get your estimate, no strings attached. PRICE THIS VENUE 1 / 8 Provided by: Maitland Civic Center Report Venue On Lake Lily 407-647-2111 CALL VENUE FAVORITE Venue highlights Indoor and outdoor spaces Valet parking Venue details Style: Event Center, Outdoor Guest capacity: Accommodates up to 450 guests Services: Ceremony / Reception Indoor / Outdoor VIEW OPTIONS Location: 641 Maitland Avenue South Maitland, FL 32751 Description: Venue On Lake Lily is a beautiful banquet facility located on Lake Lily in Maitland, Florida. The centrally located venue is an affordable option that includes professional staff and a fantastic facility! The Venue On Lake Lily offers several event spaces for rent. Or you may also opt to rent the entire building for your wedding celebration. Pledge your love in a romantic waterfront ceremony out on the Lakeside Terrace. After the ceremony, guests can remain on the terrace to mix and mingle over cocktail and appetizers. You can also use the Rotary Club Room and Bar as a cocktail lounge for guests. After cocktail hour, reunite with your guests in either the East or West Wing for a delicious catered meal. Your DJ or live band will find the stage in the West Wing to their liking. The West Wing Stage also provides a great alternative to outdoor ceremonies. From planning to the final send off the friendly staff is there to serve you. READ MORE Additional details Service Options Venue notes The fee for our Rotary Room and Patio Ceremony wedding is $1000. The rental fee for our East or West Wings ranges from $1,850 to $2500 and includes 8 hour rental. Please inquire with venue for alcohol pricing options. Life Celebrations - Venue On Lake Lily - Maitland, Fl. Skip to content LIFE CELEBRATIONS Family, Reunions & Faith Life Celebrations Family, Reunions, Faith Host life events such as celebrations of life, birthdays, anniversaries, graduations, reunions, religious or social events. Venue on Lake Lily can accommodate large and small gatherings and we are sensitive to the tone and needs of your specific event. Serving Central Florida, Maitland and the surrounding Orlando areas. Located in a serene and accessible Maitland, Florida, our memorial service venue is designed to offer a peaceful and reflective atmosphere. Our life celebration event space is equipped with modern amenities to ensure your event runs smoothly, from state-of-the-art audiovisual equipment to comfortable seating arrangements. Our celebration of life venue offers a versatile and elegant space perfect for any memorial service. Whether you‚Äôre planning a large gathering or an intimate tribute, our event space for memorials is adaptable to your needs. We pride ourselves on providing a beautiful and dignified setting where friends and family can come together to honor and remember. Choose our life-honoring venue for your next commemoration event. Our memorial celebration hall is designed to provide a respectful and heartfelt environment for remembering and celebrating the life of your loved one. Let us help you create a tribute that truly honors their memory and legacy. We help families from Orlando and Central Florida daily. Contact us today to learn more about our services and to schedule a tour of our beautiful event space. Support - Venue On Lake Lily - Maitland, Fl. Skip to content SUPPORT THE VENUE Support the Venue We Welcome Your Donations DONATE SECURELY WITH PAYPAL CHECKOUT Thank you for your generosity in supporting Venue on Lake Lily. To make your donation quickly and securely use one of the options provided on this page. Venue on Lake Lily is possibly the only remaining community center of its kind in the nation. Since 1965, the Maitland Civic Center has been a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with a mission to provide a place where our community can gather and enjoy public, private and secular events, conveniently located in the heart of Central Florida. All funds from venue rentals go to administer and maintain this storied place, where memories are made. Leonard ‚ÄúLen‚Äù Schmidt It‚Äôs with a sorrowful, broken heart that we, the Board of Directors and Staff of the Venue on Lake Lily ‚Äì The Maitland Civic Center ‚Äì share that we recently lost an incredible friend, member of our Board of Directors, Vice President, and a fantastic advocate for the community of Maitland. Even before his involvement with the Maitland Civic Center, Len was an advocate for the citizens of Maitland. Through his championing the community with various causes, i.e., negotiations with the initial developers of Maitland Center to protect the community‚Äôs interests and holding City Leaders through the years accountable to their commitments to us, the community. In addition, he loved the arts and supported other community non-profits such as Performing Arts Matter, Art and History Museums Maitland, and the Maitland Library. When Len joined the Venue‚Äôs Board, he continued to champion our community‚Äôs multiple interests and, most importantly, help save the Venue during an unforeseen pandemic through his business acumen. Len was a warrior, and his passing left a great void in many lives. However, he will never be replaced. Instead, Len‚Äôs past presence will only inspire new volunteers to our community‚Äôs causes. Rest in peace, our dearest friend. You are missed! The Board of Directors, Officers, and Staff, Venue on Lake Lily ‚Äì The Maitland Civic Center LEONARD SCHMIDT MEMORIAL FUND In lieu of flowers Len‚Äôs family has designated his favorite charity, the Maitland Civic Center, for memorial contributions. The Maitland Civic Center is now accepting donations in memory of Len Schmidt. The Venue is a non-government owned, privately run 501c3 non-profit community-serving organization. Amount First Name Last Name Email Is this donation on behalf of a company? Yes Yes No Comment Submit Chris Raleigh Sadly, the Officers and Board of Directors of the Venue on Lake Lily ‚Äì The Maitland Civic Center ‚Äìshare that we recently lost an incredible friend, member, and past director of our board. Most importantly, Chris was the most devoted, loving husband, brother, uncle, and best friend you could ever imagine. He was an amazing talent, an award-winning artist/designer, and a community advocate. He leaves a void in our lives. We will forever miss him. Instead of flowers, Chris‚Äô family has designated the Venue on Lake Lily ‚Äì the Maitland Civic Center, ‚Äì as their preference for memorial contributions. The Venue is a non-government owned, privately run 501(c)3 non-profit community-serving organization. CHRIS RALEIGH MEMORIAL FUND In lieu of flowers, Chris‚Äô family has designated the Venue on Lake Lily ‚Äì the Maitland Civic Center, as their preference for memorial contributions. The Maitland Civic Center is now accepting donations in memory of Chris Raleigh. The Venue is a non-government owned, privately run 501c3 non-profit community-serving organization. Access SEARCH Advanced Filters Home Venue Maitland Civic Center Facebook Twitter Linkedin Print Maitland Civic Center Over looking beautiful Lake Lily Park and in the heart of Maitland's Cultural Corridor, the Maitland Civic Center has been serving the community, providing a facility laid out to suit a wide range of activities for over thirty-four years. The Center is unique in that it is owned by the Maitland Civic Center, Inc, a non-profit corporation. Membership is open to residents of Maitland and other nearby communities. Operations of the center are managed by an elected Board of Directors. No tax dollars have ever been used to build, improve, maintain or operate the Civic Center. The Maitland Civic Center is a beutiful venue that holds up to 200 people this makes it a great place to host parties, gatherings, etc. Over looking beautiful Lake Lily Park and in the heart of Maitland's Cultural Corridor, the Maitland Civic Center has been serving the community, providing a facility laid out to suit a wide range of activities for over thirty-four years. Floorplans & Pricing - Venue On Lake Lily - Maitland, Fl. Skip to content FLOORPLANS & PRICING Floorplans & Pricing Venue on Lake Lily‚Äôs professional staff is committed to providing exceptional service, assisting with event planning and logistics, as well as recommending catering services and coordinating with trusted vendors in North Orlando. Our expertise is guaranteed to contribute to a seamless and successful event! SEASONAL RATES MAY APPLY Our rates vary based on the time of day and day of the week. Please remember that your rental hours should account for setup, decoration, and cleanup, all of which must be completed within your designated rental time (from time-in to time-out). All room rentals include our standard tables and chairs, which will be set up before your arrival, as well as access to a caterer‚Äôs kitchen. Please check with our staff for more information on our expanse of services, availability, contractual agreements, deposits, and any of your particular or unique needs. EAST¬†WING Accommodates up to 300 Theatre or 175 Banquet All hourly rates have a three-hour minimum SATURDAY Hourly: $450 per hour | Eight Hours: $3,150 FRIDAY & SUNDAY Hourly: $350 per hour | Eight Hours: $2,450 MONDAY ‚Äì THURSDAY 9AM to 5PM: $250 per hour After 5PM: $350 per hour Add Patio rental for an additional $150 per hour WEST WING WITH STAGE Accommodates up to 400 Theatre or 220 Banquet All hourly rates have a three-hour minimum SATURDAY Hourly: $450 per hour | Eight Hours: $3,150 FRIDAY & SUNDAY Hourly: $350 per hour | Eight Hours:$2,450 MONDAY ‚Äì THURSDAY 9AM to 5PM: $250 per hour After 5PM: $350 per hour Add Patio rental for additional $150 per hour East Wing West Wing Stage East Wing West Wing ROTARY CLUB ROOM & BAR Accommodates up to 45 Theatre or 32¬†Banquet All hourly rates have a two-hour minimum SATURDAY Hourly: $200 per hour | Eight Hours: $1,400 FRIDAY & SUNDAY Hourly: $175 per hour | Eight Hours: $1,225 MONDAY ‚Äì THURSDAY 9AM to 5PM: $100 per hour After 5PM: $175 per hour ROTARY CLUB ROOM & BAR WITH LAKESIDE PATIO Rotary Club accommodates up to 45¬†Theatre or 32 Banquet Please inquire with staff regarding Patio capacity. All hourly rates have a three-hour minimum SATURDAY Hourly:¬†$250 per hour |¬†Eight¬†Hours:¬†$1,750 FRIDAY & SUNDAY Hourly:¬†$225 per hour¬†|¬†Eight¬†Hours:¬†$1,575 MONDAY ‚Äì THURSDAY 9AM to 5PM:¬†$150 per hour After 5PM:¬†$225 per hour ENTIRE BUILDING INCLUDING ROTARY CLUB ROOM & BAR WITH LAKESIDE PATIO All hourly rates have a four-hour minimum SATURDAY Hourly: $900 per hour | Eight Hours: $6,300 FRIDAY & SUNDAY Hourly: $800 per hour | Eight Hours: $5,600 MONDAY ‚Äì THURSDAY 9AM to 5PM: $700 per hour | Eight Hours: $4,900 After 5PM: $800 per hour | Eight Hours: $5,600 Wedding Packages Designed with the Bride in Mind! The ceremony package includes: 2 hours on the patio overlooking Lake Lily & in the Rotary Club Room White arbor Aisle runner Lanterns with LED candles All of these items are set up for you on your special day for just $1000.00 (Access to Lake Lily available for photos after ceremony) * You may purchase extra hours for $200 per hour *The patio is also available for rental hourly (with a two hour minimum), please ask for details. Event Equipment Chafing Pans with Sterno ‚Äî $25 each Cleaning Service ‚Äî $150 Kitchen Cleaning Service ‚Äî $100 High Top Tables (Incl. Black Linen‚ÄîLimited Availability) ‚Äî $20¬†each Table Linens (Black, White, or Ivory) ‚Äî $15 each Replacement Linen ‚Äî $30 each Pipe & Drape (per 12 ft. section‚ÄîBlack or White) ‚Äî $25 Piano ‚Äî $40 Please note: A catering surcharge of $200 applies when one of our preferred caterers is not used. Medical Staff means all physicians, dentists, oral surgeons, and podiatrists who have been appointed to the Medical Staff by the Board. Program Staff means a person employed by the local program who is knowledgeable in a particular subject matter. For the purposes of the complaint process, program staff may not be involved in a specific complaint prior to the receipt of the complaint or the request for a review of the complaint. Clinical staff means persons who work in a hospital whose duties include the personal care or medical treatment of patients. ‚ÄúClinical staff‚Äù includes, but is not limited to, credentialed physicians, physicians‚Äô assistants, nurses, nursing aides, medical technicians, therapists, and other individuals involved in the personal care or medical treatment of patients. Access SEARCH Advanced Filters Home Venue Maitland Civic Center Facebook Twitter Linkedin Print Maitland Civic Center Over looking beautiful Lake Lily Park and in the heart of Maitland's Cultural Corridor, the Maitland Civic Center has been serving the community, providing a facility laid out to suit a wide range of activities for over thirty-four years. The Center is unique in that it is owned by the Maitland Civic Center, Inc, a non-profit corporation. Membership is open to residents of Maitland and other nearby communities. Operations of the center are managed by an elected Board of Directors. No tax dollars have ever been used to build, improve, maintain or operate the Civic Center. The Maitland Civic Center is a beutiful venue that holds up to 200 people this makes it a great place to host parties, gatherings, etc. Over looking beautiful Lake Lily Park and in the heart of Maitland's Cultural Corridor, the Maitland Civic Center has been serving the community, providing a facility laid out to suit a wide range of activities for over thirty-four years. About Us ‚Äì venueonlakelily Skip to content ABOUT US Mission & Venue History About Us Mission & Venue History Our Vision We continue to be Maitland‚Äôs premier events center. Possibly the only remaining community center of its kind in the nation. Since 1965, Venue on Lake Lily (originally incorporated as Maitland Civic Center) has been a Maitland residents grown and supported nonprofit organization with a mission to provide a place where our community can gather and enjoy public, private and secular events, conveniently located in the heart of Central Florida. All funds from venue rentals go to administer and maintain this storied place, where memories are made. With a rich history of community engagement, the Venue on Lake Lily is where neighbors come to celebrate, learn, socialize, and, more importantly, make lasting memories. We provide facilities for civic, religious, literary, charitable, educational, social and recreational interests of Maitland residents and businesses. Founded and funded by residents of our community, we are a non-government-owned/supported non-profit that has thrived for decades. As with all places that enjoy rare tenure, The Venue is continuing its journey as a vital member of the community by exploring ways to serve its mission to serve our community. ‚ÄúThe Venue on Lake Lily continues to evolve and become increasingly important as a place where memories are made.‚Äù ‚Äî Renee Charlan Current Officers: Renee Charlan President and Chairwoman of the Board Howard Scheiferdecker Vice-President Jonnie Mae Warner Secretary Ed Hampden Treasurer Directors: Jody Barry Justin Brownlee Ashley Green Moore Mark Terry Kim Valdes Benjamin Wurtzel Executive Director: Les Callahan Les Callahan Executive Director Back to Top 641 Maitland Ave S, Maitland, FL 32751 venue@venueonlakelily.com 407-647-2111 ¬©2024 Venue on Lake Lily Facebook Instagram Linkedin Pinterest Plan Your Event Weddings Life Celebrations Corporate Events Special Events Political Events Floorplans & Pricing Planning Resources Preferred Caterers Weddings Life Celebrations Corporate Events Special Events Political Events Floorplans & Pricing Planning Resources Preferred Caterers About the Venue About Us Corks & Forks We Invite You to Get Involved Support the Venue Frequently Asked Questions Contact About Us Corks & Forks We Invite You to Get Involved Support the Venue Frequently Asked Questions Contact Brand Brought to Life by Facebook Instagram Linkedin Pinterest Brand Brought to Life by Where memories are made 641 Maitland Ave S. Orlando Family Events Calendar ‚Äì Things to Do with Kids in Central Florida Discover the Orlando Family Events Calendar , your go-to guide for things to do with kids and families in Central Florida. From exciting Orlando festivals, family-friendly fairs, and seasonal holiday events to local story times, free community activities, and weekend fun across Orange, Seminole, Osceola, Lake, and Volusia counties, our calendar makes it easy to plan memorable outings. Whether you‚Äôre looking for kid-friendly events, indoor play, outdoor adventures, or special attractions like theme park happenings, our Central Florida events calendar Images by Blue Sunglass Photos With our Orlando Family Events Calendar , you can easily filter events by category to find exactly what fits your family‚Äôs needs. Browse holiday celebrations, free and low-cost events, back-to-school activities, seasonal festivals, and so much more. You can also filter by venue, city, cost, or even check out our featured events to quickly discover what‚Äôs happening near you. You can view listings by the day to plan their schedule, flip through different days to explore new opportunities, or switch to the monthly calendar view for a big-picture look at everything happening across Orlando and Central Florida. If you‚Äôre hosting a family-friendly event, you can even submit it directly to our calendar here . Want to have events and news deliverd to your inbox, click here to sign up for our weekly newsletters! Be sure to always double and triple check dates, times, and details of any event before heading out, as event producers may make last-minute changes without notifying us, and occasional errors may occur when loading events into the calendar. We're happy you're here! This website was designed to assist families with finding resources, ideas and things to do within the Central Florida community. We encourage all families to check and double check all events, information and news prior to making decisions for their families because, while we strive for perfection, information, news, events, and details always will and do change. Our website contains paid, non-paid, and in-trade mentions, articles, and reviews of organizations, events, schools and businesses throughout Central Florida. These mentions are for informational purposes only and should not be considered an endorsement. Please do further research on your own before choosing an event, organization, school or business to engage with. Families and individuals using our site assume all risks from any activities they participate in. MyCentralFloridaFamily.com, Epic Expos, Inc., their employees and owners are not responsible for any injuries or issues that come from participating in any of the events or opportunities listed on our website or social pages. All users/readers/visitors to MyCentralFloridaFamily.com agree to hold Epic Expos, Inc. and all of it's entities harmless in any such claims. With that said, we hope you find our website and social pages full of fun ideas and opportunities to make family memories and make your Central Florida living easier than ever. About Us - Venue On Lake Lily - Maitland, Fl. Skip to content ABOUT US Mission & Venue History About Us Mission & Venue History Our Vision We continue to be North Orlando and Maitland‚Äôs premier events center. Possibly the only remaining community center of its kind in the nation. Since 1965, Venue on Lake Lily (originally incorporated as Maitland Civic Center) has been a Maitland residents grown and supported nonprofit organization with a mission to provide a place where our community can gather and enjoy public, private and secular events, conveniently located in the heart of Central Florida. All funds from venue rentals go to administer and maintain this storied place, where memories are made. With a rich history of community engagement, the Venue on Lake Lily is where neighbors come to celebrate, learn, socialize, and, more importantly, make lasting memories. Serving North Orlando and all of Central Florida, We provide facilities for civic, religious, literary, charitable, educational, social and recreational interests of Maitland residents and businesses. Founded and funded by residents of our community, we are a non-government-owned/supported non-profit that has thrived for decades.
